To the Editor: I cannot resist adding a postscript to the article about the collapse of Premier Cruises (''After Premier, Refund Routes'' (Practical Traveler, Oct. 1).

Last October we booked a Western Mediterranean cruise on the Rembrandt of Premier. On paper the itinerary was ideal -- Barcelona, Cannes, Florence, Rome, Naples and Palma de Majorca. Because of rough seas and a mechanical problem, the ship canceled Cannes, Naples and Palma. Premier promised to reimburse us in some manner.

Several weeks later we received an offer of a free three-, four- or seven-day cruise. We chose a seven-day cruise from New York to Montreal on the Rembrandt. We were blessed with perfect weather, a luxurious, well-appointed ship, a terrific staff, diversified activities and -- best of all -- stops in Bar Harbor, Halifax, Quebec and Montreal. We regret that Premier ran into financial difficulties. We would have booked again with them.
MARILYN BIERMAN BEN BIERMAN New Hyde Park, N.Y.
